intro: Lepiderema papuana, commonly known as the Papuan lepiderma, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, particularly Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Lepidobotryaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, waxy surface. Lepiderema papuana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
